III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was bitten twice by another youth on 1-20-25. This left an
open wound on the side of his arm and the wound was not
treated. Since the incident, he has become sick, and the staff are
denying him medical treatment. Youth A vomited 6 times in a row.
Youth A is weak, he has a sore throat, and he is unable to eat or
swallow. No other details are known.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via phone on 1/28/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/30/2025
along with the MDHHS Specialist. Staff 5 reported that they
recalled the altercation between Youth A and Youth B however did
not recall what happened. Staff 5 reported that she was not there
when it occurred but heard that Youth A and Youth B got into a
physical altercation and that Youth B bit Youth A. Staff 5 did not
have any further information regarding the incident or if the bite
broke the skin or what occurred after. Staff 5 denied awareness of
Youth A receiving medical attention following the altercation. Staff
5 did not have any information regarding Youth A being ill.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/30/2025
along with the MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported that the
altercation between Youth A and Youth B occurred around
7:30pm and that it occurred on the parking lot staircase. Staff 2
reported that youth were beginning preparation for bed. Youth B
had his headphones on and Youth A was antagonizing him
verbally such as calling him a bitch and a hoe. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A walked past Staff 2, over to Youth B and at that time
Youth B turned around and pushed Youth A then tried to kick
Youth A. Staff 2 reported he stepped in between them to attempt
to separate them. Staff 2 reported Youth B attempted to bite Youth
A and succeeded in biting his upper right shoulder. Staff 2
reported that there was a mark but that it did not break the skin
and Youth A was not bleeding. Staff 2 denied awareness if Youth
A saw a doctor. Staff 2 reported that typically, the nurse would
look at a youth and determine if further medical attention is
needed. Staff 2 reported that he believed the nurse was
contacted. Staff 2 initially denied knowledge of youth A being ill
however then clarified that he did recall Youth A throwing up
recently and was not sure what day it was. Staff 2 denied
knowledge of Youth A requesting to see a doctor at any time. Staff
2 reported he was not present when Youth A was sick however
was told about him being sick. Staff 2 reported Youth A was taken
to the doctor for the illness and put on medication.
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school on 1/30/2025
along with the MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported that he
remembers getting into a fight with youth B and Youth B biting him
on his shoulder, Youth A showed the consultant and DHHS staff
his shoulder and pointed to where the bite was. It was not clear
from observation if skin had broken at any point. There was no
bruising or red marks. Youth A reported that he was walking up
the stairs and Youth B pushed him against the wall and bit him.
Youth A reported Youth B bit him two times and he bled. Youth A
reported Staff 2 was present. Youth A reported staff told them to
stop. Youth A reported he was recently sick and threw up. Youth A
reported that he told staff and Staff 3 told him he would go to the
doctor. Youth A reported that he did not go to the doctor and did
not know why he did not go to the doctor. Youth A reported that no
one looked at his bite mark after the fight. Youth A then
remembered that he did go to the doctor and was given
medication, but he did not remember when.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at school on 1/30/2025
along with the MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported he bit Youth A
and could not remember exactly when it happened. Youth B
reported it was on the stairwell. Youth B reported that the fight
began because Youth A was talking “shit” so he took Youth A by
the shoulder and bit him after shoving Youth A against the wall.
Youth B pointed to his own arm where he bit Youth A, which was
his right arm towards the shoulder. Youth B reported he bit Youth
A onetime, and it did bleed. Youth B reported he did not know
what happened after or if Youth A was seen by a doctor or nurse.
Youth B reported that he did not remember which staff was there
or what they did. Youth B denied knowledge of Youth A being ill or
throwing up at any time.
Nurse was interviewed via telephone on 2/5/2025 along with the
MDHHS Specialist. Nurse reported she was not onsite at the time
of Youth A being bitten but was told about it after. Nurse reported
that a photo of the area was sent to her to be examined and
provide direction. Nurse reported that there was no broken skin
and that it was not bleeding. Nurse reported she gave the directive
to apply a bandage and ointment. Nurse reported that this
exchange occurred via a group text that she no longer has access
to due to one of the employees no longer working at the facility.
Nurse reported that there is no nurse’s note regarding this
incident. Nurse reported that as long as the skin was not broken
there would be no need for further treatment or examination by a
doctor. Nurse reported that she did recall being told that Youth A
had been sick and that he was sent out to be seen by a doctor.
Nurse reported that Youth A was put on Tamiflu.
3

Nurse was again interviewed via phone on 2/25/2025. Nurse
reported that instructions were given to apply ointment and a
bandage for patient comfort only, when asked what the purpose
would be if the skin was not broken.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 2/5/2025 along with the
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported that she was not present for
the incident between Youth A and Youth B however was informed
about it after. Staff 3 reported she was on the group chat with the
photo and the nurse giving direction to apply ointment and a
Band-Aid, and that the skin was not broken. Staff 3 reported that
she remembered that Youth A was sick and does not recall if
Youth A came and told her himself that he was sick or if he asked
her about going to the doctor. Staff 3 reported that Youth A was
taken to the doctor. Staff 3 reported that Youth A had been the
first Youth bitten while she has worked here. Staff 3 reported that
to her knowledge they alert the nurse and follow instructions from
there.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/5/2025 along with the
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported that he is a former employee
and that he was terminated due to an improper restraint. Staff 4
reported that he vaguely recalled the incident with Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 4 reported that he recalled Youth B biting Youth A
and that he had been making his way over to assist Staff 2 to get
the boys to stop fighting. Staff 4 reported by the time he got to
them, the fight had stopped. Staff 4 reported that he did not see
the bite occur. Staff 4 denied awareness of anyone else being
present. Staff 4 denied remembering if the bite broke the skin,
seeing any blood, or if Youth A was seen by anyone after. Staff 4
denied knowledge of Youth A being taken to a doctor for any
reason including illness.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with the MDHHS Specialist. Youth C denied seeing any
incidents between Youth A and Youth B. Youth C reported that
when youth get into fights, staff always intervene by telling them to
stop or getting in between them. Youth C denied any instances in
which staff did not try to intervene or harm a youth during
intervention. Youth C denied knowledge of Youth A bleeding.
Youth C denied knowledge of Youth A being sick. Youth C
reported that when anyone is sick or wants to go to the doctor
they tell staff and then they get taken to the doctor. Youth C
denied any knowledge of any youth not being taken to the doctor
when they need to or want to go.
Documentation reviewed:
4

• Incident report dated 1/19/2025. The incident report details
the altercation between Youth A and Youth B and Staff 2
attempting to separate the youth with verbal redirection and
attempting to place himself between the youth. The incident
report details Youth A being bitten by youth B and that
ointment and a Band-Aid were administered. The incident
report denies that further medical attention was needed.
• Beamont Urgent Care Summary dated 1/24/2025 details
that youth A was seen by a doctor and diagnosed with the
flu. Youth A was prescribed Tamilflu.
• Wolverine Human Services Health and Dental Procedures
and Oversight Policy was reviewed. The Policy states that
all clients will have access to and be provided with
specialized care as appropriate.
Analysis A violation is not established regarding this allegation. There is
insufficient evidence based on denials from staff and youth, that
the bite broke the skin thus requiring medical treatment. All staff
consistently report that Youth A was taken to the doctor for the flu,
there is documentation from Beaumont Urgent Care confirming
that the youth was seen for medical attention.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance is being provided regarding documentation
of nurse’s notes and directives. Notations of directives and
correspondence between staff to determine courses of action
should be saved on file. Notations on incident reports should
include who examined a youth and their directives. The incident
report failed to document if the bite broke the skin and there were
no documented notes to view confirming the nurses assessment.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
